channel.title: WebSockets/REST for database operations in an n-tier application
channel.description: So I'm writing an n-tier application consisting of a database, login server, game server. Currently my game server is performing all of the database operations with the database. I would like to extract the database operations to another service/server. I'm not sure which one would be better though. I haven't used Websockets/REST for anything java related. What would the benefits of this be?

item.title: WebSockets/REST for database operations in an n-tier application
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:3, topic:545088”][quote author=Pwnd link=topic=663967.msg4438015#msg4438015 date=1405695983]
The benefit would be organization and possibly load balancing. Perhaps even scalability!
[/quote]

I’ve only every worked with Web Services using WCF. I haven’t done them with Java. Is it the same process? ie. Could I expose some Login functionality to only the login server, some game functionality to only the game server, and a public API for everything else?[/quote]I would be pretty sure, yes.
